main.title: Galaxy Platform Directory: Servers, Clouds, and Deployable Resources
main.content:
This directory lists platforms where you can use or deploy your own Galaxy Server with minimal effort.

  • Almost all of them are free to use (Commercial clouds are the exception)
  • Almost all of them are open to everyone (Academic clouds are the exception).
  • All of the resources can be used, either immediately, or shortly after getting an account.

These resources cover a wide spectrum of domains all across life sciences. There are resources for genomics (lots of them), metagenomics, transcriptomics, proteomics, drug discovery and even some outside biology like natural language processing (a couple of them), and social science.

node.title: AB-OpenLab
node.summary: FROG stands for **F**inge**R**printing **O**ntology of **G**enomic variations. FROG fingerprints have been devised to capture genomic variations at various levels.

node.title: ABiMS
node.summary: Analysis and bioinformatics for Marine Science.

node.title: AGEseq @ AspenDB
node.summary: This site provides a user-friendly interface for AGEseq (Analysis of Genome Editing by Sequencing) in a Galaxy instance.

node.title: ANASTASIA
node.summary: **A**utomated **N**ucleotide **A**minoacid **S**equences **T**ranslational pl**A**tform for **S**ystemic **I**nterpretation and **A**nalysis

node.title: APOSTL
node.summary: Automated Processing of SAINT Templated Layouts (APOSTL) is a freely available software suite and analysis pipeline for reproducible, interactive analysis of AP-MS data.

node.title: ARGA
node.summary: Antibiotic Resistance Gene Analyzer

node.title: ARGs-OAP
node.summary: Fast annotation and classification of antibiotic resistance gene-like sequences from metagenomic data.

node.title: ARIAweb
node.summary: Automated NOE assignment and NMR structure calculation

node.title: ARIES
node.summary: Analysis of genomic data in the field of public health and food safety, with the aim of deploying a comprehensive bioinformatics approach to the study of food-borne zoonoses and infectious diseases at the human and animal interface.

node.title: ASaiM
node.summary: Integrates tools specifically chosen for metagenomic and metatranscriptomic studies and hierarchically organized to orient user choice toward the best tool for a given task.

node.title: ATACgraph
node.summary: ATAC-seq for biologists with minimal bioinformatics knowledge to analyze chromatin accessibility

node.title: Amazon Web Services (AWS)
node.summary: Set up you own general purpose genomics server runing AWS using GVL and CloudMan.

node.title: AnVIL
node.summary: Run Galaxy inside the secure AnVIL environment on Google Cloud Platform.

node.title: BF2I-MAP
node.summary: Locally developed as well as standard tools are available on a 16-core server with 32GB memory, accessible to all users, and located in the BF2I lab.

node.title: BIPAA (BioInformatics Platform for Agroecosystem Arthropods)
node.summary: Insect genomics (aphids, parasitoïd wasps, lepidopterans)

node.title: BRIDGE
node.summary: Prepare, simulate and analyse and visualise molecular simulations, especially molecular dynamics and free energies.

node.title: BioBix
node.summary: A general genomics server. Includes the PROTEOFORMER pipeline tools.

node.title: BioCiphers Lab Galaxy
node.summary: BCL Galaxy gives a user friendly interface for analysis tools developed by the [BioCiphers Lab](http://biociphers.org/) at the University of Pennsylvania.

node.title: BioCompute Object Galaxy
node.summary: [BioCompute Objects](https://biocomputeobject.org/about.html)  is a standard for communication of High-throughput Sequencing (HTS) analysis results, data set creation and curation, and bioinformatics verification protocols.

node.title: BioDivine Toolset
node.summary: Systems biology tools implemented by the Sybila team.

node.title: BioMaS
node.summary: Taxonomic studies of environmental microbial communities

node.title: Biomina
node.summary: A general purpose Galaxy instance that includes most standard tools for DNA/RNA sequencing, plus extra tools for panel resequencing, variant annotation and some tools for Illumina SNParray analysis.

node.title: BitLAB
node.summary: Detailed analysis of metagenomes.

node.title: CAFU
node.summary: A Galaxy framework for exploring unmapped RNA-Seq data

node.title: CBiB Galaxy
node.summary: A general purpose Galaxy instance that includes EMBOSS (a software analysis package for molecular biology) and fibronectin (diversity analysis of synthetic libraries of a Fibronectin domain).

node.title: CIRM-CFBP
node.summary: Web based access to tools ([SkIf](https://sourcesup.renater.fr/wiki/skif/), [KI-S](https://sourcesup.renater.fr/wiki/ki-s/)) of IRHS-EmerSys lab.

node.title: CLIMB
node.summary: The CLIMB project (Cloud Infrastructure for Microbial Bioinformatics) develops and deploys a world leading cyber-infrastructure for microbial bioinformatics; providing free cloud-based compute, storage, and analysis tools for academic microbiologists in the UK.

node.title: CLIP-Explorer
node.summary: The CLIP-Explorer is a webserver to process, analyse and visualise CLIP-Seq data.

node.title: COVID-19
node.summary: A companion to our study describing the analysis of early COVID-19 data

node.title: CRAVAT-P
node.summary: A Docker image containing a fully-operational Galaxy instance with pre-installed demonstration material for CRAVAT-P.

node.title: CellOrganizer for Galaxy
node.summary: Create generative models of the spatial organization of cells from microscope images and automatically provide geometries for spatial simulations of cell processes and behaviors

node.title: Center for Phage Technology (CPT)
node.summary: Phage biology and automated annotation.

node.title: ChemFlow
node.summary: Chemometrics without programming: infrared spectrometry on a Galaxy platform.

node.title: Chemical Annotation Retrieval Toolkit (CART)
node.summary: Retrieves annotations on biological effects of chemicals and determines which ones are enriched.

node.title: ChemicalToolbox
node.summary: For processing, analysing and visualising chemical data, and performing molecular simulations.

node.title: Cistrome Analysis Pipeline
node.summary: ChIP-chip/seq and gene expression data

node.title: Climate Science Workbench
node.summary: A comprehensive set of analysis tools and consolidated workflows for climate analysis and visualisation

node.title: CoSSci
node.summary: Tools for solving [Galton's problem](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Galton's_problem) in Comparative Research and complex network problems in Social Science.

node.title: Codon Harmonizer
node.summary: Easily generate codon harmonized variants of gene sequences for heterologous expression

node.title: Coloc-stats
node.summary: a unified web interface to perform co-localization analysis of genomic features

node.title: CorGAT
node.summary: Align complete assemblies of SARS-CoV-2 genomes wih the reference genomic sequence, to obtain a list of polymorphic positions and to annotate genetic variants.

node.title: CoralSNP
node.summary: Standard Tools for Acroporid Genotyping (STAG)

node.title: Dintor
node.summary: GWA and NGS tools and modules for functional annotation of genes and gene products

node.title: DocMethyl EpiMOLAS
node.summary: Galaxy Docker for DNA methylation analysis in WGBS

node.title: EWAS-Galaxy
node.summary: Galaxy Docker image for population epigenetics data analysis

node.title: Epigenomics Galaxy
node.summary: Galaxy Docker image for epigenomics analysis

node.title: Erasmus MC
node.summary: General purpose genomics analysis, featuring many standard tools plus many additional tools.

node.title: Excellence in Breeding
node.summary: Hosts tools for the [GOBii project](http://gobiiproject.org/), [HTPG project](http://cegsb.icrisat.org/high-throughput-genotyping-project-htpg/) and [EiB platform](http://excellenceinbreeding.org/), including genomic selection, marker selection, GWAS, imputation, file conversion, and cluster analysis.

node.title: FreeBioinfo
node.summary: Galaxy for metagenomic analysis.

node.title: G-OnRamp
node.summary: G-OnRamp provides a user-friendly, web-based platform for collaborative, end-to-end annotation of eukaryotic genomes using UCSC Assembly Hubs and JBrowse/Apollo genome browsers with evidence tracks derived from sequence alignments, ab initio gene predictors, RNA-Seq data, and repeat finders.

node.title: GASLINI
node.summary: Supports PIPE-T, a tool for Reverse transcription quantitative real-time polymerase chain reaction (RT-qPCR) analysis.

node.title: GCAC : Galaxy for Compound Activity Classification
node.summary: GCAC is a web enabled platform for predictive model building using R and caret package for virtual screening.

node.title: GalaxEast
node.summary: Integrative 'omics data analysis

node.title: Galaxy Africa
node.summary: Devoted to assisting researchers on the African continent accelerate their genomics research and analyses.

node.title: Galaxy BLAST+
node.summary: A complete and production ready Galaxy instance with installed BLAST+ tools.

node.title: Galaxy Docker
node.summary: The Galaxy Docker Image is an easy distributable full-fledged Galaxy installation, that can be used for testing, teaching and presenting new tools and features.

node.title: Galaxy Exome-Seq
node.summary: Galaxy Docker repository for Exome sequencing data analysis

node.title: Galaxy Genome Annotation (GGA)
node.summary: Galaxy for genome annotation

node.title: Galaxy Imaging
node.summary: Galaxy Docker repository for image analysis

node.title: Galaxy Integrated Omics (GIO)
node.summary: Proteomics Informed by Transcriptomics (PIT) methodology, and selection of surrogate peptides for targeted proteomics.

node.title: Galaxy Test
node.summary: Beta version of Galaxy Main

node.title: Galaxy Workbench for Mass Spectrometry Imaging
node.summary: Galaxy Docker image for mass spec imaging

node.title: Galaxy basic sequence manipulation
node.summary: Galaxy Docker repository for basic sequence data analysis.

node.title: Galaxy for Ecology
node.summary: A web platform to get, process, analyze and visualize ecological data

node.title: Galaxy mothur Toolset Docker
node.summary: Galaxy Docker image for microbial ecology analysis with [mothur](https://www.mothur.org/)

node.title: Galaxy-P
node.summary: Galaxy-P is a multiple 'omics' data analysis platform with particular emphasis on mass spectrometry based proteomics. Galaxy-P is developed at the [University of Minnesota](http://umn.edu/), deployed at the [Minnesota Supercomputing Institute](http://msi.umn.edu/).

node.title: Galaxy-SynBioCAD
node.summary: Synthetic biology and metabolic engineering

node.title: Galaxy@GenOuest
node.summary: A general purpose Galaxy server Includes tools developped by [Dyliss](http://www.irisa.fr/dyliss/) and [GenScale](https://team.inria.fr/genscale/) bioinformatics research teams in Rennes, France.

node.title: Galaxy@PRABI
node.summary: Includes bioinformatics tools developed by the research teams working in the perimeter of the PRABI core facility, including *kissplice/kissDE, TETools, SEX-DETector,* and *priam*.

node.title: Galaxy@Pasteur
node.summary: General purpose genomics analysis server.

node.title: GalaxyTrakr
node.summary: Supporting food-borne pathogen research

node.title: GenAP
node.summary: All Canadian researchers are [eligible for a GenAP account](https://ccdb.computecanada.ca/account_application). International researchers that have a Canadian collaborator can also be sponsored and become eligible to a GenAP account as well.

node.title: GeneLab
node.summary: NASA GeneLab is a comprehensive space-related omics database in which users can upload, download, share, store, and analyze spaceflight and corresponding model organism data.

node.title: Genomic Hyperbrowser
node.summary: Statistical methodology and computing power to handle a variety of biological inquires on genomic datasets

node.title: GigaGalaxy
node.summary: GigaGalaxy hosts tools and data analyses from papers published in *[GigaScience](http://www.gigasciencejournal.com/)*.

node.title: Globus Genomics
node.summary: Globus Genomics provides hardened high-performance Galaxy servers running with Globus on AWS.

node.title: GrAPPA
node.summary: GrAPPA is a web-based interface constructed on the Galaxy framework for graph theoretical tools. It contains novel combinatorial methods integrated into a complete microarray analysis toolchain, from uploading raw high-throughput data to visualization of results.

node.title: GraphClust
node.summary: [GraphClust2](https://github.com/BackofenLab/GraphClust-2) is a workflow for scalable clustering of RNAs based on sequence and secondary structures feature. GraphClust2 is implemented within the Galaxy framework and consists a set of integrated Galaxy tools and flavors of the linear-time clustering workflow.

node.title: Halogen Bonding
node.summary: Visualize halogen bond contacts in the protein binding site. Analyze a protein binding site for halogen bonding hotspots. Evaluate halogen contacts with the protein backbone using the scoring function XBScore.

node.title: Hardwood Genomics
node.summary: A simplified, workflow-centic interface to Galaxy, focused on genomics data from hardwood trees.

node.title: HiCExplorer
node.summary: Tools to process and visualize chromosome conformation.

node.title: Human Cell Atlas
node.summary: Tools and workflows for the analysis of Single Cell RNA-Seq data. It includes a module that connects to the Matrix Service API of the [Human Cell Atlas](https://www.humancellatlas.org/)’s Data Coordination Platform that enables retrieval of gene expression matrices from any data sets in the Human Cell Atlas.

node.title: Huttenhower Lab
node.summary: metagenomic and functional genomic analyses, intended for research and academic use

node.title: HyPhy HIV NGS Tools
node.summary: Tools for HIV sequencing analysis.

node.title: IBERS @ Aberystwyth
node.summary: Software, tools and pages written by IBERS researchers for release to the wider community.

node.title: IDENAP
node.summary: Inter-Domain Ecological Network Analysis Pipeline

node.title: IPK Galaxy Blast Suite
node.summary: Part of the IPK Crop Analysis Tools Suite (CATS). Offers access to genomic references published by IPK and collaborative projects

node.title: Image Analysis and Processing Toolkit
node.summary: Image analysis and processing.

node.title: ImmPort Galaxy
node.summary: Flow Cytometry Analysis.

node.title: InteractoMIX
node.summary: A one-stop resource offering a wide range of computational analyses from proteome-wide interactomes to structure of protein complexes

node.title: Jetstream
node.summary: [Jetstream](http://jetstream-cloud.org/) is part of [XSEDE](https://www.xsede.org/), a "collection of integrated advanced digital resources and services" and is funded by NSF.

node.title: LAPPS Grid
node.summary: An open, interoperable web service platform for natural language processing (NLP) research and development.

node.title: Langille Lab
node.summary: Prediction of the unobserved character states in a community of organisms from phylogenetic information.

node.title: Laniakea
node.summary: Laniakea provides the possibility to automate the creation of Galaxy-based virtualized environments through an easy setup procedure, providing an on-demand workspace ready to be used by life scientists and bioinformaticians, with built-in storage encryption for user data.

node.title: Lebanese University Galaxy
node.summary: Includes the SpCLUST tool set for fast and reliable clustering of potentially divergent biological sequences

node.title: LiSIs
node.summary: A platform for Virtual Screening.

node.title: Lifeportal
node.summary: a Galaxy instance to satisfy the computational needs of the Norwegian research community in life sciences but also of any other user willing to use the service.

node.title: MGS-Fast
node.summary: Shotgun whole-genome metagenomic analysis using DNA-DNA alignment

node.title: MISSISSIPPI
node.summary: Support for analyses of RNA and small RNA sequencing datasets as well as for epigenetics or metagenomics studies.

node.title: MaREA4Galaxy
node.summary: Metabolic Reaction Enrichment Analysis and visualization of RNA-seq data

node.title: Machine Learning Workbench
node.summary: A comprehensive set of data preprocessing, machine learning, deep learning and visualisation tools, consolidated workflows for end-to-end machine learning analysis and training materials to showcase the usage of these tools.

node.title: Majewski Lab
node.summary: Detection of recurrent Allelic Imbalance in tumors using whole Exome sequencing data.

node.title: Mandoiu Lab
node.summary: A customized installation of the Galaxy framework deploying bioinformatic tools and pipelines developed in the [Mandoiu Lab](http://dna.engr.uconn.edu/) at the [University of Connecticut](http://www.uconn.edu/) for high-throughput sequencing and immunogenomics data analysis

node.title: Martin Luther U. Halle-Wittenberg
node.summary: Provides implementations of [GeMoMa](http://www.jstacs.de/index.php/GeMoMa), InMoDe, CRISPRer, TALgetter, TALgetterLong, TALENoffer, and Dimont

node.title: MetaCentrum
node.summary: MetaCentrum regional virtual organization of the Czech National Grid Infrastructure (NGI) and is accessible to employees and students of research and academic organizations of the Czech Republic and for scientific purposes only.

node.title: Metabolomics
node.summary: A community driven metabolomics Galaxy service

node.title: Metagenomics
node.summary: a webserver to process, analyse and visualize Metagenomic and Microbiota data in general.

node.title: Metaproteomics Gateway
node.summary: Metaproteomics gateway providing access to documentation and other instructional materials, and an opportunity for hands-on training using example datasets and optimized metaproteomics workflows

node.title: MiModD NacreousMap
node.summary: NacreousMap mapping/plotting tool of MiModD for users of MiModD who do not want to install the required dependencies (R and rpy2) for graphical output from this tool on their local system.

node.title: Migale
node.summary: A general purpose genomics server with an emphasis on metagenomics, including FROGS and several Migale developed tools.

node.title: Molecular Property Diagnostic Suite - Diabetes Mellitus Portal (MPDSDM)
node.summary: A disease-specific open source web portal for Diabetes Mellitus.

node.title: Molecular Property Diagnostic Suite - Tuberculosis (MPDSTB)
node.summary: A disease-specific web portal for Tuberculosis for drug discovery and development.

node.title: NG-Tax
node.summary: A Semantic Framework for High-throughput Marker Gene (Amplicon) Analysis

node.title: NGPhylogeny.fr
node.summary: Robust phylogenetic analysis for everyone.

node.title: NanoGalaxy
node.summary: a webserver to process, analyse and visualize Oxford Nanopore Technologies (ONT) data and similar long-reads technologies.

node.title: Nectar Cloud
node.summary: Set up a Galaxy server on Australia's Nectar research cloud.

node.title: NetworkAnalyst
node.summary: For mapping and quantification of raw RNA-seq data

node.title: OSDDlinux LiveGalaxy
node.summary: Drug discovery

node.title: Oqtans
node.summary: Customized Galaxy, extended with machine learning based tools for sequence and tiling array data analysis.

node.title: Orione
node.summary: A Galaxy based web server for microbiology. [Orione](http://orione.crs4.it/) includes all post mapping or assembling steps from scaffolding to complete annotation pipelines.

node.title: Osiris
node.summary: Phylogenetics

node.title: PIA
node.summary: Phylogenetics and gene interaction

node.title: Palfinder
node.summary: Microsatellite development.

node.title: PepSimili
node.summary: Integrated workflow tool for mapping of massive peptide repertoires on whole proteomes and delivering streamlined, systems-level biological interpretation.

node.title: PhagePromotor
node.summary: Predict promoter sequences in phage genomes, using machine learning models.

node.title: PhenoMeNal
node.summary: Large scale computing for medical informatics

node.title: PiRATE: a Pipeline to Retrieve and Annotate Transposable Elements
node.summary: Detect, classify and annotate TEs of non-model organisms.

node.title: Plant Anaylsis Workbench
node.summary: A community driven plant data analsys Galaxy service

node.title: PlantGenIE
node.summary: Plant Genome Integrative Explorer Galaxy instance

node.title: PreSTIGE
node.summary: Predicting Specific Tissue Interactions of Genes and Enhancers

node.title: ProteoRE
node.summary: ProteoRE (Proteomics Research Environment)

node.title: Proteogenomics Gateway
node.summary: Provides access to documentation and other instructional materials, and an opportunity for hands-on training using example datasets and optimized proteogenomics workflows. The main goal of this server is to provide documentation to facilitate training and mastery of these software and workflows.

node.title: Protologger
node.summary: All-in-one genome description tool, aimed at simplifying gathering the data required for writing protologues. This includes providing taxonomic, functional and ecological insights.

node.title: QuanTP
node.summary: A Docker image containing a fully-operational Galaxy instance with pre-installed QuanTP tools.

node.title: RNA Modification Calling
node.summary: Galaxy Docker image for RNA analysis and modification calling

node.title: RNA Workbench
node.summary: more than 50 bioinformatics tools dedicated to different research areas of RNA biology, including RNA structure analysis, RNA alignment, RNA annotation, RNA-protein interaction, ribosome profiling, RNA-Seq analysis, and RNA target prediction.

node.title: RepeatExplorer
node.summary: Graph-based clustering and characterization of repetitive sequences, and detection of transposable element protein coding domains.

node.title: RiboGalaxy
node.summary: Tools for the analysis and visualization of ribo-seq data obtained with the ribosome profiling technique.

node.title: Rice Galaxy
node.summary: Tools for designing single-nucleotide polymorphism assays, analyzing genome-wide association studies, population diversity, rice−bacterial pathogen diagnostics, and a suite of published genomic prediction methods.

node.title: SARS-CoV-2 ENA Submission
node.summary: Galaxy Docker image for submitting SARS-CoV-2 data to ENA

node.title: SHAMAN
node.summary: A user-friendly website for metataxonomic analysis from raw reads to statistical analysis

node.title: SMAGEXP
node.summary: SMAGEXP (Statistical Meta-Analysis for Gene EXPression) provides a unified way to carry out meta-analysis of gene expression data, while taking care of their specificities.

node.title: SNIC Science Cloud (SSC)
node.summary: A national-scale cloud infrastructure for Swedish Academia

node.title: Sciensano
node.summary: General purpose Galaxy server optimized for microbiological genomics applications of interest for public health.

node.title: Shapiro Lab
node.summary: RNA structure and design tools including RNA2D3D and StructureLab

node.title: Single Cell Omics workbench
node.summary: The Single Cell Omics workbench is a comprehensive set of analysis tools and consolidated workflows

node.title: South Green
node.summary: Genomic resource analysis of southern and Mediterranean plants.

node.title: Street Science
node.summary: a Galaxy dedicated for the Street Science Community

node.title: SymD
node.summary: a platform for detecting internally symmetric protein structures

node.title: TGM
node.summary: The *TGM pipeline* is a workflow combining tranSMART server, Galaxy Server and MINERVA platform to enable visually-aided exploration, analysis and interpretation of high-throughput translational medicine data.

node.title: TreeGenes
node.summary: TreeGenes integrates genotype, phenotype, and environmental data that can be processed for association mapping and landscape genomics, with a focus on forest trees. This functionality is provided by [Tripal Galaxy](https://github.com/tripal/tripal_galaxy), a module for [Tripal](http://tripal.info) that provides seamless support for running Galaxy workflows directly in the site. Users can analyze data provided by TreeGenes or their own.

node.title: USMI Galaxy Demonstrator
node.summary: This Galaxy implementation is meant to demonstrate integration of microbial domain Biological Resource Center (mBRC) catalogues into the bioinformatics data integration environment.

node.title: UseGalaxy.be
node.summary: General purpose genomics Galaxy server

node.title: UseGalaxy.eu
node.summary: The European UseGalaxy server.

node.title: UseGalaxy.fr
node.summary: General purpose genomics Galaxy server

node.title: UseGalaxy.no
node.summary: A central, joint & free Galaxy instance for Norway-based researchers and their collaborators, with ~2000 bioinformatics tools, 200GB short-term storage and project storage on nels.bioinfo.no.

node.title: UseGalaxy.org (Main)
node.summary: The [Galaxy Project](/galaxy-project/) free public server; biomedical research

node.title: UseGalaxy.org.au
node.summary: The Australian UseGalaxy server.

node.title: VEuPathDB Galaxy
node.summary: A free, interactive, web-based platform for large-scale data analysis focused on eukaryotic pathogens. Merges the former VectorBase and EuPathDB servers.

node.title: VINYL (Variant prIoritizatioN bY survivaL analysis)
node.summary: A flexible and fully automated system for the functional annotation and prioritization of genetic variants.

node.title: Vinther Lab
node.summary: RNA structure-probing data analysis to improve the prediction of RNA secondary and tertiary structure and allow structural changes to be identified and investigated.

node.title: VirAmp
node.summary: VirAmp is a web-based semi-*de novo* fast virus genome assembly pipeline designed for extremely high coverage NGS data.

node.title: Viral Variant Visualizer (VVV)
node.summary: Determine the composition of a viral population

node.title: Virology
node.summary: A comprehensive set of analysis tools and consolidated workflows for virology work, including SARS-CoV-2.

node.title: Wageningen UR
node.summary: Includes microarray tools, the MUMmer suite, and many conversion tools. Strong focus on multi-omics: next to genomics tools it also contains proteomics and metabolomics tools

node.title: Workflow4Metabolomics
node.summary: A collaborative portal dedicated to metabolomics data processing, analysis and annotation.

node.title: deepTS
node.summary: Explore transcriptional switches from pairwise, temporal, and population RNA-Seq using deepTS.

node.title: epiGeEC
node.summary: Compare user-provided epigenomic datasets with thousands of public datasets.

node.title: immuneML
node.summary: Machine learning-based analysis and classification of adaptive immune receptors and repertoires (AIRR).

node.title: miCloud
node.summary: Leverage cloud technologies to provide an easy-to-use streamlined NGS data analysis using local computational hardware

node.title: q2Galaxy
node.summary: QIIME 2 Galaxy Docker image.

node.title: wQAP
node.summary: QAP is an open source software that can be used to analyze virus quasispecies using CBS, NGS and TGS data. wQAP (web QAP), is the online version of QAP.
